div.sent: In the Bible this mystery of new life through baptism has been beautifully expressed through an event.
Do you know what that is ?
There was a Jewish leader named Nicodemus.
He had heard many things about Jesus, and he had come to put his faith in Jesus to certain extent.
Out of fear of the Jews he had not professed his faith publicly.
One night he came to meet Jesus secretly.
He said to Jesus, I have heard many things about you.
I believe you came from God.
That is why you can perform the miracles you are doing.
This could not happen unless God were with you.
Jesus told him, you are right.
somewhat awkwardly he asked, Man is born of his mothers womb just once.
What then is new life ?
Jesus explained to him saying, This new birth is from water and the Spirit.
Without this new birth, no one can understand the power and the grace of God.
A person is born physically of human parents, but he has to be born spiritually of the Spirit.
In order to enter into the Kingdom of God, every person has to be born anew.
The Lord Jesus tried to explain to Nicodemus about the work of the Spirit saying, The wind blows wherever it wishes;
you hear the sound it makes, but you do not know where it comes from or where it is going.
It is like that with everyone who is born of the Spirit.
Even then Nicodemus did not understand.
He asked, How is a person born of the Spirit ?
Jesus mildly rebuked him.
For Nicodemus was teacher in Israel, still he did not understand about the power and the works of the Spirit of God.
So, Jesus told him that man's ignorance and blindness create an obstacle to understanding the truth of God.
Nicodemus was unable to understand what Jesus was saying because of his mental block.
He did not understand that Jesus was Christ, the Messiah of God.
It is faith in Jesus that leads to eternal life.
And it is impossible for man to believe in Jesus without the light of the Holy Spirit.
From this we-can understand what Jesus was saying.
We can enter into eternal life by being baptized in water and the Spirit.
Water keeps us alive.
We use water to clean everything.
The use of water at baptism gives us a taste of life.
It cleanses us from our sins and makes us pure and holy.
Like the wind, the spirit gives us life.
It leads us to the way of God and gives us power.
By coming into contact with water and the Spirit, we, are transformed into a new being by the power of God.
We are not merely flesh and blood; we are God's beloved children.
We do not belong to the world, but to heaven.
By being redeemed our sinful nature, we put on Christ.
And by being united with Christ, we receive new life.
In mind and heart, in our total existence we become a new being, In the words of Jesus.
we are `reborn.
After the ceremony of baptism we sing, What, a change after my new birth !
I have become a new being.
When man accepts Jesus in his life, he gains new insight.
He begins to see things that he never saw before.
This new insight is the result of man's new birth.
And this happens through baptism.
New life begins in a person at the time of baptism.
He becomes a new being.
He is enlightened by Christ, the darkness of his former life disappears.
Jesus said, Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved;
whoever does not believe will be condemned.
Jesus left for Judea after his meeting with Nicodemus.
His disciples were with him.
Jesus stayed there for a few days and his disciples baptized many people.
At the same time John the Baptist was also baptizing.
Many people came to him and were baptized.
John's baptism was mainly for conversion.
He baptized people by immersion as a sign of conversion from their past sins.
At this time an argument was started about the matter of ritual washing between John's disciples and a Jew.
Those disciples went to John and told him about Jesus.
They told him that the disciples of the man (Jesus) about whom he had testified were baptizing other people.
Many people were going to him for baptism.
John then explained to his disciples that what Jesus and his disciples were doing was the work of God.
He came on earth precisely to do this work.
This means that John was pleased and happy when he heard that Jesus was baptizing.
He reminded his disciples of the testimony he had given about Jesus.
He said, I am not the Christ; but I have been sent ahead of him.
This indicates that John's mission of preparing the way was over and Jesus was starting his work of saving mankind.
Jesus will gradually reveal himself as the Saviour and John will become less important.
This was the will of God.
John was successful in carrying out his mission of preparing the people for the coming of Jesus the Messiah.
Therefore, he was happy.
Now the promised Messiah has come down from heaven.
Jesus Christ is the Anointed one.
Jesus will reveal God's truth to people through his life and teaching, and mankind will see his salvation.
Whoever believes in Jesus Christ, the Son of God, and .
listens to his words will receive eternal life.
Through this testimony of John we come to see the difference between John and Jesus, as well as between John's baptism and that of Jesus.
He is much greater than I am; and I am not good enough even to carry his sandals.
Therefore, he is the Son of God anointed by the Holy Spirit.
His baptism is not merely with water; nor is it merely for repentance.
But rather, his baptism is with water and the Holy Spirit (compared with iii-e).
By this baptism a person is made a new creation, just as it happened at the first creation.
Being united with Christ, we are given a new life.
So, the first step to faith in Christ is baptism.
In the life of believer, this baptism is important and necessary.
This baptism symbolized the washing away of the past sins and entering into new life.
This life of a believer is a participation in the Resurrection of the Lord.
Like Jesus, many Christians at first had received the baptism of John.
But later they were baptized in the Holy Spirit (i.e., in the name of the Holy Trinity, as prescribed by Jesus).
When they heard this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
Paul placed his hands on them, and the Holy Spirit came upon them.
We need to realize the importance of baptism above all things.
For baptism introduces us into the Church and makes us members of the Mystical Body of Christ with rights and duties.
Moreover, through repentance for our life before our baptism and for our former sins it leads us into a new life.
Hence, once a person is baptized, it cannot be changed or re-baptized.
St. Paul said, It is through faith that all of you are God's sons in union with Christ Jesus.
